conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend the movie "Smilla's Sense of Snow". This movie stars Vanessa Redgrave and is based on a true story about a Inuit girl named Smilla who grows up in an empty house after her parents die in a plane crash. Smilla is eventually taken care of by the Danish government and is sent to a school for disabled children. However, despite being diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) at age 6, Smilla is able to communicate effectively with others. She also has a talent for drawing and creating art. In addition to her own personal experiences, Smilla is able to draw on the cultural traditions and practices of the Inuit people.
